content.question: Let R be the region enclosed by the graphs of y = ln(x2 + 1) and y = cos x. (a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text: Let R be the region enclosed by the graphs of y = ln(x2 + 1) and y = cos x. (a) Find the area of R.
(b) Write an expression involving one or more integrals that gives the length of the boundary of the region R. Do not evaluate.

(c) The base of a solid is the region R. Each cross section of the solid perpendicular to the x-axis is an equilateral triangle. Write an expression involving one or more integrals that gives the volume of the solid. Do not evaluate.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
